quests.name: The Basics
quests.description: Botanical magic is about mana manipulation in order to perform various tasks around the world. Exploring Botania will yield powerful baubles and items, as well as new sets of armor and unique tools. The Lexica Botania contains full documentation of this mod, however this quest line serves as a supplemental tutorial line for those that wish to obtain a better understanding of progression or those wishing to accomplish milestones. If you are ever in doubt, simply refer to the Lexica Botania once more.

tasks.longDescription: The Petal Apothecary is a stable construct in which all flowers are made. In order to operate the petal apothecary, fill it with water and throw each item of a desired recipe into the apothecary. Once complete, throw a seed of any kind to complete the crafting.

The Pure Daisy is the first flower to be created. It allows you to create Livingwood and Livingrock by placing logs and stone around the daisy. These materials will be crucial for many builds later on, so there is never a harm in stocking up.

quests.name: Mana Theory
quests.description: Many items and blocks will require some form of mana to be consumed. Flowers are split into two categories, mana producing flowers and mana consuming flowers. In order to begin creating and storing mana, you must first create a mana pool and a mana spreader. The mana pool will hold an extremely large amount of mana, while the mana spreader transports mana from flowers to the mana pool.

tasks.longDescription: While flowers typically perform their job without trouble, they can be rather silly in creating connections to nearby mana spreaders. In order to bind a flower to a spreader, you must create the wand of the forest. This wand has two modes, a Binding mode a Function mode which can be switched by shift right-clicking. In order to bind a flower, ensure the wand is in binding mode and shift right-click the flower until a box appears, and shift right-click the desired location.

quests.name: Mana Generation
quests.description: The vast majority of mana generation will come from mana generating flowers. Mana generating flowers can be broken down into two categories, passive generation and active generation. Passive flowers do not have an associated cost for producing mana, however they produce a very small amount of mana and will only live for three days. Active flowers will live indefinitely, can produce much more mana, however typically cost resources.

tasks.longDescription: It is recommended you create additional nightshades or dayblooms until your mana pool has enough mana to create mana powder for an Endoflame.

quests.name: Mana Consumption
quests.description: The Mana Pool adds a unique function of transforming some mundane items into mana-infused ones by simply tossing the items in. Mana steel is unique in that it can be repaired by mana in the users inventory when created into armor or tools.

tasks.longDescription: Active flowers produce exponentially more mana.

quests.name: Rune Theory
quests.description: Runes allow you to create extremely powerful tools, baubles, and additional flowers. Rune crafting is the process in which items are combined on a Runic Altar with a small amount of mana. To do this, you must first create a runic altar. In order to give mana to the runic altar, you must point a mana spreader in the direction of the runic altar. The fastest way to do this is to place a mana spreader adjacent to a mana pool, and the runic altar in front of the mana spreader. Mana will be transferred directly from the pool into the altar at an extremely fast rate.

tasks.longDescription: To place items on the altar, simply right click them on the altar. To remove an item, shift right-click with an empty hand to remove the item from the altar. When the desired recipe is on the altar, click the altar with a Wand of the Forest to start the process. Once finished, throw one living rock on the altar and right click with the wand of the forest to complete the rune creation.

quests.name: Mana Utility
quests.description: As your collection of flowers grows, it can become tiresome to bind each flower individually. A floral obedience stick will bind all nearby flowers to a single block. Another useful item to have is the Manastar. When placed next to a mana pool, the Manastar will alert you when your mana consumption is outpacing your production. Useful for when managing large systems.
